alert.note: Alert for Daggett (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 12:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FULL POWERPLANT AND BYPASS RELEASE IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor hydrologic flooding caused by upstream dam release is expected. The flow will remain near bankfull stage for the next seven days. * WHERE...The Green River below Flaming Gorge Reservoir in portions of northwest Colorado and northeast Utah, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Moffat. In northeast Utah, Daggett. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM MDT Thursday Jun 02. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas. River flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM MDT, an upstream reservoir release is expected to cause minor flooding in the advisory area.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks can become unstable and unsafe.
